api

Class Move

  • java.lang.Object
    • api.Move

  • public class Move
extends java.lang.Object
    A Move object describes the motion of one tile (or two tiles in the case of a merge move) in the Threes game. A move is represented by the old and new indices of the tile or tiles within a one-dimensional array. In addition, it is possible to also specify a Direction and a row or column index, so that the move could be interpreted as taking place in a two-dimensional grid. For example, given a Move with startIndex 0, newIndex 1, rowOrColumn 2 and direction UP, in a 5 x 5 grid it would correspond to a move from (4, 2) to (3, 2).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Move(int oldIndex, int newIndex, int value)
      Constructs a single-tile move from oldPos to newPos.
      Move(int startIndex, int endIndex, int currentValue, int currentValue2, int newValue)
      Constructs a merge move from startIndex to endIndex, assuming that the left tile of the pair being merged is at startIndex - 1.
      Move(int startIndex, int startIndex2, int endIndex, int currentValue, int currentValue2, int newValue)
      Constructs a merge move from tiles at startIndex and startIndex2 to endIndex, where the left tile of the pair being merged is at startIndex2.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Move

        public Move(int oldIndex,
            int newIndex,
            int value)
        Constructs a single-tile move from oldPos to newPos. Caller should ensure that newPos is strictly less than oldPos.
        Parameters:
        oldIndex - old index of the tile within an array
        newIndex - new index of the tile within an array
        value - current value of the tile

      • Move

        public Move(int startIndex,
            int endIndex,
            int currentValue,
            int currentValue2,
            int newValue)
        Constructs a merge move from startIndex to endIndex, assuming that the left tile of the pair being merged is at startIndex - 1.
        Parameters:
        startIndex - old index of the right tile of the pair being merged
        endIndex - new index of the right tile of the pair being merged
        currentValue - current value of the right tile of the pair
        currentValue2 - current value of the left tile
        newValue - new value on the tile after merging

      • Move

        public Move(int startIndex,
            int startIndex2,
            int endIndex,
            int currentValue,
            int currentValue2,
            int newValue)
        Constructs a merge move from tiles at startIndex and startIndex2 to endIndex, where the left tile of the pair being merged is at startIndex2.
        Parameters:
        startIndex - old index of the right tile of the pair being merged
        startIndex2 - old index of the left tile of the pair being merged
        endIndex - new index of the right tile of the pair being merged
        currentValue - current value of the right tile of the pair
        currentValue2 - current value of the left tile
        newValue - new value on the tile after merging
